topic: Comparison and Contrast of Opinions with Those in Familiar Texts

definitions.title: Transition Words for Similarities
definitions.definition: Words that show how ideas are alike or related.
definitions.example: Example: Likewise, both stories teach kindness.

definitions.title: Transition Words for Contrast
definitions.definition: Words that show differences or opposing ideas.
definitions.example: Example: On the contrary, her opinion differs from his.
definitions.explanation: ‘On the contrary’ signals contrast between two statements.

definitions.title: Identifying Contrast Words
definitions.definition: Not all transition words show contrast—some express similarity.
definitions.example: Example: ‘Unlike’ and ‘conversely’ show difference, but ‘likewise’ shows similarity.
definitions.explanation: ‘Likewise’ doesn’t belong because it shows comparison, not contrast.

definitions.title: Use of 'However'
definitions.definition: ‘However’ is used to show contrast between two ideas.
definitions.example: Example: I like my sweater; however, it only comes in one color.
definitions.explanation: ‘However’ connects two opposing ideas—liking the sweater but having a limitation.

definitions.title: Finding Similarities
definitions.definition: When comparing, look for traits that two things share.
definitions.example: Example: Both Susan and Juan like ice cream.
definitions.explanation: The similarity is their shared preference for ice cream.

definitions.title: Identifying Differences
definitions.definition: To contrast, identify how two subjects are not the same.
definitions.example: Example: Ana had a large house, but Lisa’s was small.
definitions.explanation: ‘But’ is a contrast word showing difference in house size.

definitions.title: Contrasting Characters
definitions.definition: Contrast helps highlight opposite traits between characters.
definitions.example: Example: Cinderella is kind, but her stepsisters are not.
definitions.explanation: This sentence contrasts kindness with cruelty using ‘but’.

definitions.title: Finding Common Traits
definitions.definition: Comparing identifies shared actions or interests.
definitions.example: Example: Mila and Gloria enjoy swimming.
definitions.explanation: Both sisters like the same activity, showing similarity.

definitions.title: Comparing Occupations
definitions.definition: Comparison can be used to show common responsibilities or roles.
definitions.example: Example: Both the teacher and the doctor work with many people.
definitions.explanation: They share a similarity in interacting with others daily.

definitions.title: Comparing and Contrasting Ideas
definitions.definition: Compare similarities and contrast differences for deeper understanding.
definitions.example: Example: Both nuts and peanuts are good for snacking.
definitions.explanation: This focuses on their shared quality, despite other differences.

definitions.title: Contrast Signal Words
definitions.definition: Used to show how ideas or things differ from one another.
definitions.example: Example: As opposed to last year, this plan worked well.
definitions.explanation: ‘As opposed to’ signals contrast between two situations.

definitions.title: Meaning of Compare
definitions.definition: To examine how things are similar or different.
definitions.example: Example: We compare two poems to see how their themes are alike or different.
definitions.explanation: ‘Compare’ involves identifying both similarities and differences.

definitions.title: Use of 'Likewise'
definitions.definition: ‘Likewise’ shows a comparison or similarity between two ideas.
definitions.example: Example: That orange is delicious; likewise, this apple is very flavorful.
definitions.explanation: ‘Likewise’ connects two similar statements showing shared quality.

definitions.title: Signal Words for Comparison
definitions.definition: Words that indicate likeness between two or more things.
definitions.example: Example: Likewise, as well, and the same as show comparison.
definitions.explanation: These expressions link similar ideas or concepts.

definitions.title: Words That Do Not Show Contrast
definitions.definition: Some transition words express similarity instead of difference.
definitions.explanation: It connects similar ideas instead of opposing ones.
